Posts.Content: Birdsnest wrote: Dear ladies, I know - this is a silly question, there are much more serious problems discussed on this board.. I've been waiting for a while to get my by biopsy date after a suspicios mammogram. I am happy that I have a date, but it falls on the day before the period starts (my body works pretty much like a clock), so my breasts will be super tender and swollen. And still hurting from the almost 2 weeks old mammogram.. I am getting another mammo followed by core needle biopsy and I am trying to figure out in how much pain I'm going to be. As is, just from the diagnostic mammo I have hard time when my kids lean on my breasts and pain in the armpit. Wondering if you were in a similar situation - having biopsy when your dense larg-ish breasts are the most sensitive. How was the healing process? When were you back to normal and not twiching in pain each time your breasts touch something? Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: biopsy happens on the day just before my period starts? Birdsnest SillyMama

Posts.Content: Birdsnest wrote: Hi ladies, I am going to have my biopsy done at UCSF, so would appreciate if anyone could share their experiences. I know, small chance, but worth a shot. Hope you are having a good day and staying positive no matter what! Thank you in advance. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone here going to UCSF for their procedures? Birdsnest Birdsnest
